definition: spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In that case, I definitely overpaid for my carpet.
sentences.chinese: 那樣的話，我買地毯就絕對當了冤大頭。

sentences.english: I don't want customers to feel they are being taken for a ride.
sentences.chinese: 我不想讓顧客們感到他們是冤大頭。

sentences.english: The asking price for players we were looking at just wasn't realistic and we held off.
sentences.chinese: 我們觀察的球員的要價都太高，我們不會當冤大頭。

sentences.english: People who give money to charities are suckers.
sentences.chinese: 給錢給慈善機構的人是冤大頭。

sentences.english: They really soak the tourists in that restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 他們在那家餐廳真的把觀光客當成冤大頭。
有些人天生就是冤大頭。

sentences.english: But they should always sell for substantially less than top-grade fruits, like half-price; if you pay full price for culls you are being rooked.
sentences.chinese: 如果你付了全部的價格的話你就是冤大頭了。

definition: to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
clever and eloquent (idiom); fluent/having the gift of the gab
